first of all natives and especially
Americans tend to pronounce the T sound
like a soft D which is called a flap or
an American T for example the word
better and water are pronounced as
better and water the general but not
complete rule is that the flap T happens
when the T sound is surrounded by vowel
sounds and the previous syllable is
stressed
for example the T sound embedder and
water has bowel sounds on both sides of
the T and both are stressed on the first
syllable better and water this can also
happen with a T at the start or end of
the word and as we see in today's scene
